articles.summary: It's the 11th hour for countries to respond to irreversible climate change, security experts agreed at the fourth annual NATO Climate Change and Security Summit. The gathering brought together 280 attendees between Oct. 8 and 9 to war-game climate change at the newest transnational challenge.

articles.title: Record rise in carbon dioxide levels during 2024: UN weather agency (UNOG - United Nations Office at Geneva)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Asteroid carbon dioxide levels rose by a record amount in 2024. The rise was driven by continued human emissions, more wildfire activity and weakened absorption. It locked in further long-term warming and extreme weather, according to the World Meteorological Organization (WMO).

articles.title: Environment Canada issues frost advisory for parts of Niagara, Halton, Peel and Chatham-Kent
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: Environment Canada is warning growers to protect frost-sensitive plants in parts of Niagara, Halton, Peel and Chatham-Kent on Thursday morning due to a possible frost threat.       .   "Frosty weather" is expected in some parts of Canada.
